page.title: 10Tamar Valley,Local History 1
page.content: An{historic house}in the area is Halton Barton, mentioned in the original Domesday Book. Once the Manor House owning most of the surrounding land, this is now a private dwelling. Even the{supernatural}is catered for as the house is believed to be haunted. Other Historical Buildings in the area include a Mine Captain's House, a Mine Count House, a former Iron Smelting Works and a former Basket Maker's workshop. A{monument}in the area is the mausoleum on the Pentillie Estate. It was built by an eccentric who directed that after his death he should be clothed and seated in his chair. He is still there but flat on his back in a coffin. Evidence of{religion}is found in the existence of a Holy Well at Chapel Farm which has a statue of St. Dominica (founder of the local Church) in its niche.
